meanings.definition: To rent out (property) that one has rented from another.
meanings.sent1: I subrented my apartment to a friend while I was away on vacation.
meanings.sent2: She subrents her parking space to her neighbor for extra income.
meanings.sent3: The cat subrented the dog's bed when he wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: The idea of subrenting my car for the weekend seemed like a smart move.
meanings.sent5: Subrenting can be a convenient way to make some extra money.

meanings.sent1: Subrent can be a helpful option for tenants who need to move out temporarily.
meanings.sent2: The subrent of the office space was handled smoothly by the property manager.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors began when the subrent of the apartment turned out to be a famous actor.
meanings.sent4: The subrent of the warehouse was like a game of musical chairs, with different businesses coming and going.
meanings.sent5: The subrent of the beach house was a topic of discussion among the vacationers.
